page.title: 19Highfields Farm, Draycott
page.content:
Highfields Farm is on the main road which passes through Draycott. The Farm is about 108 acres. 60 acres are used for crops, such as barley and the rest is used for grazing and hay and silage. This is mainly a beef producing unit. It has got 42 cattle, mostly heifers but some bullocks. In addition there are chickens and horses.
The combine harvester is a New Holland. There are 3 tractors, which take a wide variety appliances. Most of them are used in some way or another in the harvest. The first step in the harvest is to plough and sow the seed in the autumn. It is not until the following September that the time has come to harvest the barley which is mainly used as animal feed.
